Reviews.Title: “Stategically located ...”
Reviews.Author: ConTodos
Reviews.Content: At the center of Paris, I was surprised to discover such a quality hotel any North American will enjoy. Rooms are reasonably sized considering "room sizes" in/around Paris. The buffet style breakfast provides flexibility if you're attending an event. I was also quite surprised I didn't have to use my European French accent to have the staff understand me ... quite a plus in Paris... otherwise I would simply speak English while being Quebec French. You are 10-15 mins (wlaking) away from many attractions (Jardin du Luxembourg) and 30 mins tops from other main attractions such as Notre-Dame ... Five min walk to the famous restaurant Les Deux Magots... which did not impress me after eating and drinking wine South of France, but nothetheless real nice.... There is a bar right across the hotel for a younger local crowd which is quite an experience... if you don't mind proximity :) A real good choice indeed .. Voilà !

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tumblinon
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after a week in Madrid. We were a little battered, because the staff at the hotel in Madrid was very unhelpful. Ooh la la. The staff at Hotel Le Littre are professionals. The desk personnel put their heads together to help us plan day trips. They had a good supply of Metro tickets, schedules for attractions, etc., and they made reservations for us with aplomb. We witnessed the employees being very patient with nervous older guests who did not speak French and were strident about not being able to use the Metro, etc. I so enjoyed being greeted by everyone I encountered with a vigorous, cheerful, "Bonjour, Madame!" I really enjoyed the wake up calls. Sexy David woke me up with a mellifluous "Bonjour, Madame, This is your wake up call. Have a wonderful day." Did this old lady a world of good. No robo calls at Hotel Le Littre. The rooms are very comfortable with good mattresses, ample closet space, and satellite television, which made my husband happy. The baths have a nice shower and tub with good water pressure and an adjustable shower head. The breakfast has a very wide selection of breads, hams, cheeses, fruits, pastries, and juices, as well as scrambled eggs. The coffee and tea are excellent. The housekeeper is diligent at checking the rooms, and the maids are very good. The hotel is on a quiet street around the corner from restaurants, shopping, the Metro, and bus stops. It is easy to get to all the attractions. You cannot go wrong if you stay at Hotel Le Littre. We were in the hands of hotel management pros. Our pleasant stay there still resonates.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely tucked away and great value”
Reviews.Author: jobm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely tucked away hotel on a quiet street, however but near the Montparnasse area and lots of activity. Many attractions, restaurants,etc. can be accessed through local Metro stops-easy to use or just plain walking because of its central location. Staff is friendly, very helpful and great value for the hotel. Wifi internet access is present throughout hotel and rooms, however they charge 5 Euro for entire stay. Would be probably easier if they gave Wifi to everyone and include it in room price. Nice, hearty breakfast with lots of variety, but could get boring if you are there for seven nights like we were. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: trevbann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small jewel tucked away down a charming little street. It's situation is pretty near perfect. I found it so easy to walk to Notre Dame from here via the Luxembourg Gardens. The metro and bus stop for Open Top bus are only just around the corner from the hotel. Breakfast is simply superb but what shines above all is the attitude of the staff - they are so very friendly and helpful. Look no more you have found your hotel, believe me.

Reviews.Title: “A home way from home”
Reviews.Author: ggd
Reviews.Content: from the time we stepped foot into the Hotel Le Littre until the time we left, we felt as though we were part of a welcoming family. The room was large and clean with lots of closet space. The breakfast was great and the staff wonderful. The location was pretty central and the choices of dining outstanding. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Colin B
Reviews.Content: we had a great 4 nights here rooms were good , staff very helpful , metro station a great place to get anywhere all round great place to base yourself, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I like the Hotel Le Littre because everything was consistently good. Many good places to stay get 3 or 4 out of 5 things right, but on our visit Hotel Littre got everything right. Hence I rate it as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OUR NEW PARISIAN HOME: A Room with a (great) view â€¦and terrace thrown in”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: If you want your very own room or suite with the best view of Paris from your private terrace; the Le Littre is a must. When it was first suggested that we try Le Littre my first reaction was: who wants to be all the way out there. In the middle of nowhere! Do you know how long it would take to get back to Saint Germain or the Musee Dâ€™Orsay? Well, it is not in the middle of no- where; it is in the midst of a vibrant part of Paris that used to be home to Hemmingway, Fitzgerald, Satre, Chagall, Picasso and Man Ray. Nestled on a small street steps from teeming Blvd. Montparnasse and the Montparnasse train station; surrounded by many great bistros and brasseries, and convenient to stops of the 4 Paris-Metro lines this is a Parisian keeper. It is about a 20 minute walk from the heart of Saint Germain and half that from the Luxembourg Gardens The rooms for Paris are big; it was converted after WW II to house U.S. Air force staff. The staff is friendly, the service good, the breakfast included and plentiful, but it is the terraces and view of the Eiffel tower on the top two floor of the hotel that make this place so very special. We stayed in 801, which is access by a special key to the elevator, making the eighth floor feel safe and secluded. The suite had big rooms, fireplaces and a big terrace that could be accessed from both the living room and the bed room. The furnishings were would one would expect from a hotel in Paris of this class but sitting on the terrace, any time of day or night gazing at the Eiffel Tower, beautiful in the day and exquisite with its new lighting at night made this hotel and this suite one of special memories. Totally there are about 8 rooms with views and terraces. After 3 nights we moved to the elegant Georges V with its superb appointments and service, but frankly despite all the fabulous food, dÃ©cor and service we missed the Le Littre and its view and bustling surroundings. Itâ€™s Le Littre next time! With every hotel in Paris to choose from for our next trip, we will book a room with a terrace at Le Littre for our next trip. Does that say enough!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: AMCandFMC
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel, conveniently located for the bus and metro hub at Gare Montparnasse. Room was clean and functional and larger than other hotels in paris we have stayed in. Reception staff very helpful, willing to make restaurant reservations etc.

Reviews.Title: “Mikhail & Liudmila”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice. The last time in January this year. Advantage is the ratio of cost and quality of services. The main difference from most other similar Paris hotels more spacious rooms and a normal breakfast. Very welcoming and friendly staff, especially at the reception. Convenient location in a quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: the hotel le littre is beautiful... we stayed at the hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary feb 2012 the hotel is very clean and the service was fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We had the room with the eiffel tower view (804) this is Breathtaking.The bed and facilities in the room were very comfortable and the bath was suburb especially as it was so cold. The hotel is adjacent to the Montrapansse where there are loads of restaurants and fabulous bar within two minute walking distance. We will definitely be returning hopefully next time in the summer to see paris in its true beauty. Thank you to all the staff at the hotel for making our anniversary so memorable. Ian and Julie Cox

Reviews.Title: “Bon”
Reviews.Author: cadicatkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Littre for a short break (4 nights) at the beginning of January. A great location for visiting Paris. We had 1 superior room and 1 standard room, the difference between the rooms was miminal (glass shower screen instead of a curtain). The rooms were very clean, comfortable and for Paris large. All the staff were pleasant, attentive and extremely helpful. The breakfast was excellent. Would I reckomend this hotel - Yes

Reviews.Title: “A Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mandab84
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself, left it a little late to book into our preferred hotels in the 7th Arrondisment and this hotel seemed to meet most requirements. On arrival the staff were perfectly pleasant. We had booked a junior suite and by Parisian standards the room was large and the bathroom was huge. Rare in Paris. However, we noticed on our 2nd night the bed line had not been changed. Not really what we had expected! We received conflicting responses from the desk staff as to standard house keeping proceedures! We were told the linen was only changed every two days!! On the morning we were checking out I rang downstairs to have the hotel book a table for lunch at a nearby restaurant. I was told it was not necessary. When we arrived at the restaurant it was so full we had to wait 45mins. Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Angela458
Reviews.Content: This was the end of our month long holiday in France and what a perfect ending it was. From the moment we arrived we were most impressed with the efficiency, friendliness and helpful attitude of all the staff. Our room #609 was a standard room with doors to a terrace overlooking the street and with a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The room was large with plenty of wardrobe space and drawers for our clothes. The bathroom was huge, light and well equipped too. This was our 3rd visit to Paris, 1st time at this hotel and it certainly wont be our last. The area is very central, close to excellent restaurants, shops and the metro system. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough

Reviews.Title: “A welcome surprise!”
Reviews.Author: hmamsterdam
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Hotel Le Littre and it turned out to be more than satisfactory. We had booked a superior triple room but were upgraded to a jr. suite on the 8th and top floor. Tastefully appointed, clean, roomy, comfortable beds, very quiet, big bathroom and a large terrace that would be fabulous in the Summer months. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. As for breakfast, it was generous and for those who like espresso, there's a little bar on the corner of the street that serves excellent coffee. Another huge plus is the in-house parking garage. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this traditional 4 star Parisian hotel in November 2011. Close to metro and can walk to Notre Dame through the Latin Quarter if you enjoy a good 30 min stride. Very comfortable bed and nicely decorated room. Had quiet room at back of hotel, no noise disturbance at all. Very impressed with a good breakfast choice, everything from continental to fried breakfast, meats, cheeses and fruits in a spacious dining room. Pleasant and helpful reception staff. It helped make my first trip to Paris (for my 50th birthday) a lovely break

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: srup
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Hotel Le Littre a little after midnight on Christmas day, and I was expecting the stereotypical Parisian...rude and condescending. I could not have been more wrong. The concierge, Bazari, was warm and inviting and genuinely kind. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and filling. The wait staff was also friendly and patient. If I ever come back to Paris, I would stay at Hotel Le Littre again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: sissoca
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay only two nights but plans changed and we stayed 8; they gave us a very good deal due to that extension. Very good breakfast included in the price. Clean bathroom, very helpful staff. Near the metro. Very useful for those wanting to visit Paris and not spend the day in the hotel. Even though it was very cold, the room was warm at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice position”
Reviews.Author: F1L00
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, but the service is not. 4 star hotel that still ask you 15 euro per day to use the wifi!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gmcquaid
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a very good location and is a good base for walks around Paris. The staff were very welcoming and friendly which is always a plus when checking in and looking for advice. I made a point of writing to the Hotel to compliment them on this aspect. The value is very good and the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon experience”
Reviews.Author: MariaLadzBorbz
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time on our 2nd visit to Paris, exploring the city on our own for our honeymoon and what topped off our experience was our stay at Hotel Le Littre. Our room overlooked the view of the Eiffel Tower from the 7th floor and the staff were marvellous and so helpful with their directions in using public transport. We were so close to everything and would definitely stay here again on our next visit to the city of love.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Lara8526
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel the rooms were lovely and service was really good. We were only 3 mins walk from the tube station and shops. the breakfast is lovely even had hot options too. Some rooms on the upper level of the hotel are large suites with views of the eiffel tower. Its great to visit at christmas too as there is a market nearby too

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good cost/benefit”
Reviews.Author: AlvarodeMoura
Reviews.Content: The hotel Le Littre, on the street of the same name, is a very good hotel with good rooms and excellent service, far superior to other four or three stars that have stayed in Paris. It has a delicious breakfast included, self service, which is also rare to find in other hotels. It is a safe, clean and well maintained, with a beautiful decor in the reception areas, hallways and bedrooms. It is close to many restaurants and subway stations and just minutes from Montparnasse Tower, Louxemburg Gardens and other attractions. I will probably stay there on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location average room”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie042
Reviews.Content: Great location average room. Can hear everything above below and beside you. Bfast average at best but location is excellent close to metro and walking to St Germain and Latin Quarter and Montparnasse

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a genuine surprise, our room was clean, of a fair size and had recently been refurnished. The bed was more like two mattresses pushed together so could have been a bit more comfortable but was adequate overall. The bathroom was large with a good sized bath and a proper power shower. Breakfast consisted of a good buffet spread although the cooked section could have been a bit better. It also has an atmospheric bar and attentive staff with good english. Its real strong point is its location. 2 minutes from a major metro station (Montparnasse Bienvenue) which means no changes necessary for Eiffel tower, Gare du nord, champs elysses, notre dame and only one change to Montmatre. Lots of local cafes and restaurantes on varying quality in the nearby streets to choose from. Overall a basic but clean, hotal with a great location that is actually quite good for the price. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: greg d
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed here 4 times and have enjoyed it each time. It is in a great area to walk around in. A metro station is very close. The breakfast has a wide variety of food. The employees are friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Jan L
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, gently staf, nice quiet and clean rooms. Excellent location in 6th and close to Parc Luxembourg which is a nice place for runners.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DTheriault
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located within a few minutes walk to Montparnasse Station. It was easy to find and is also very close to two different subway stations. It's a bustling area with several pubs, bistros and bakeries. The shopping on Rue Rennes is good and the hotel is a mere 15 minute walk to the St. Germain area + only about a 10 minute walk to the Jardins du Luxembourg. Upon arrival the staff was very welcoming and they took the time to explain us how the subway system worked, where the nearest station was and the even had subway tickets for sale at the front desk. The arranged our transportation to the airport and the wireless internet access was very reliable and affordable at 5 euros for the duration of our stay (two nights). There is a small grocery store just around the corner on Vaugirard. Although the listed price was a little on the expensive side, we booked several months ahead of time and managed to essentially get two nights for the price of one if you consider what they were asking the night we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Littre”
Reviews.Author: JosephAC
Reviews.Content: As always the Google Maps are deceiving. At the end of it all we were perfectly placed - close to several metro stops and the Montparnasse railway station. Reasonable walks to the major attractions. The hotel was very pleasant on all accounts. I never got by the reception desk without a greeting. If I had a question it was answered with care and sincere interest. Check in and out were handled graciously and effeciently. Housekeeping staff did a great job and always respected the do not disturb sign, the result of their work was superb - clean, neat and tidy. I would confidently recommend the Littre. Joseph

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with a freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: Iluv2travel65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at le Littre and enjoyed it very much. The location was excellent, especially if you intend on spending time in the 6th arrondissement. It is close to a connecting subway station and close enough to walk to main attractions on left and right banks. The post office is up the same street and the FNAC ticket outlet is just around the corner of the street Rennes. Montparnasse station was close by and arrival from the airport was at walking distance for Les Cars Air France. The staff was very friendly and always ready to help and suggested several nice restaurants. I only wish we could have been given a renovated room. It was our 20th wedding anniversary and eventhough they were aware of it, they did not upgrade our room, however, they gave us a complimentary bottle of water and 4 macarons as a treat. The best part of our stay was having breakfast in their buffet room. The waiters were all "sympathiques", especially Ahmad who started our mornings with smiles. Unfortunately WiFi was not in the bedrooms, but rather downstairs near the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great base, super hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: LidlPrincess
Reviews.Content: One of the things that made our recent visit to Paris so special was the super Hotel le Littre - apart from the very central yet quiet location, the staff were, without exception, friendly, attentive and always ready to help. The rooms were far more spacious than I imagined from reading previous reviews (I suspect our American friends are used to large apartments, but by European standards the rooms are VERY comfortable). The hotel proved to be the ideal base, it's well connected by Metro and the tourist busses and has a number of charming shops very nearby. The local boulangerie, bars and bistros meant that we didn't need to move far from the hotel at all to get everything we needed, night or day. All in all, very good value and we will most certainly be back. On a very personal note, my brother and I took my mother to Paris for sentimental reasons, she used to spend a lot of time there with my father when he was alive. We'd both like to thank each and every member of staff that went out of thier way to make her as comfortable as possible, whether it was the small jokes shared over breakfast or the provision of extra blankets (which arrived almost before we put the phone down). You've all given us some wonderful family memories that money could never have bought - thank you all so much.

Reviews.Title: “Dream trip”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L
Reviews.Content: Our driver gave us many wonderful tips as he drove us from the airport to our hotel, the Hotel Le Littre. Our room was ready when we arrived and the staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was clean, though a little small. We stayed here two days at the beginning of our trip and two days at the end of our trip and we got the same room both times. We had to have help driving out of Paris because our GPS wouldn't connect to the satelite. The wonderful gentleman at the front desk gave us directions all the way to Reims. Everyone was so nice and helpful, even though we spoke no French. The breakfast was included in our package and and it was a wonderful buffet. Plus the hotel is in a great location, close to the Metro and the train station where we had to pick up our car. We could even walk to the Eiffel Tower. It was a great experience over all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: LGFH
Reviews.Content: The rooms vwere good Standard double room nice clean bathroom, The staff were very helpful. free wifi in the lobby if you ask for it, We did not have breakfast but if you want a large breakfast, it is reasonable value at â‚¬20, 4 mins walk from Montparnasse metro. I would certainly use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Tres bon”
Reviews.Author: VMG_11
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to Paris through Costco so did not have a choice of hotels, but the one they chose - Hotel le Littre - was just perfect. It was very close to so many things. A boulangerie was just a few doors down the street, and the metro, Hop on/Hop off bus, restaurants, and shopping were just a couple of blocks away. Plus, if you are so inclined in Paris, McDonald's was right at the end of the street. The breakfast room was charming and there was a great variety of food. The staff was very helpful, the room was comfortable and clean, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A bijou of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: WhizLeedsUK
Reviews.Content: After much research and reading the many excellent reviews, we booked Hotel le Littre for a business/leisure weekend in Paris. We were not disappointed. The assistance we received prior to arrival from Thomas Chalet, the Rooms Division Manager, was invaluable. He always responded immediately to our email requests and went the extra mile in terms of service. On arrival, Thomas had pre-checked us in as far as he was able, and allowed us to complete and return the registration form in our own time. This meant we were checking in to our rooms within a couple of minutes of arrival. This typically Parisian hotel is superbly located: 2 mins walk from Montparnasse RER/Metro and all the bars and many restaurants/bistros that line the Boulevard du Montparnasse and St Germain de Pres. 10 mins walk from the charming bohemian Latin Quarter, the Sorbonne and Notre Dame Cathedral. Bus stops at the top of the road which will take you to all the sights in Paris. Because the hotel is situated at the bottom end of a very quiet one way street, there was no noise at all during the evening and night. You would not think that you were in the middle of a city bustling with activity 24/7. We reserved Superior Rooms with external balconies ( well worth the extra money) which overlooked the rooftops of Paris, with a bird's eye view of the Eiffel Tower - stunning when lit up with thousands of twinkling lights when dusk falls. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated and the bathroom large and well maintained and equipped with toiletries. We ordered continental breakfast in the room, which arrived within 10 minutes, and was served on our balcony in the glorious sunshine - what a treat! We also experienced breakfast in the restaurant where they served everything you could want : bacon sausage eggs etc ; variety of breads; yoghurt; fresh fruit; deli meats and cheeses, juices and choice of hot drinks. The waiters ( Mahommed and his colleagues) were constantly cracking jokes with customers and were eager to serve you. The bar man was also very polite and accommodating to our party. The staff on Reception were so helpful and responded to every enquiry with enthusiasm and a smile - Michel, Thomas and Opel stood out for us. All in all a very successful business trip and enjoyable weekend at a jewel of a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Leila G
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed this little gem of a hotel. It is very close to Metro stations and bus lines, so it provides easy access to the rest of Paris. We were in a junior suite a large room with a remodeled bathroom. Breakfast was included and is very good - wait staff lovely. The hotel manager, Thomas is wonderful. And the female staffer was very helpful with reservations for dinner. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1Traveldream
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend in Paris as a single parent with two children, based on reviews I had read on here. The hotel was all that I hoped it would be! The room was a good size for the three of us and clean and tidy. Plenty of storage space, towels & robes. The breakfast was varied & plentiful, although some of the cooked items were low & not automatically replenished, but this could have been due to our late start! The hotel was in a good location, close to a number of Metro stations & in a five minute walk from Gare du Montparnasse, where there is an Air France shuttle to either CDG or Orly airports. The staff were very helpful and suggested a great restaurant just around the corner for our evening meal. All in all a great hotel at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Perfection”
Reviews.Author: LITTLEWHISKERS
Reviews.Content: A truly brilliant boutique hotel. We have stayed here 6 times now and will continue to whenever we are in Paris. We are always welcomed as special guests. "Ma cherie", hugs, handshakes and triple kisses from Mahommed at breakfast,efficient service from Michel & all at Reception & excellent help with luggage from Opel. Quiet location yet close to Gard de Montparnasse RER & Metro, pharmacy & Post Office, corner shop & great eateries. Breakfast a visual and gourmet affair. Have been upgraded twice, once to Honeymoon Suite and a balconied room that looked across the rooftops to the Eiffel Tower & even Sacre Coeur. Excellent personalised care. Have stayed in 3 other hotels but this is THE BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: rapture_23
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a good experience!! I booked a family room for 3 three people and it was a good deal. The room was huge (by European standards), the beds where comfy, some of the furniture a bit outdated but overall not too bad. The location is close to metro, close to the center of Paris, with lots of stores, cafes and pubs withing walking distance. The only problem was with catching a cab ride to the airport, a rude guy that worked at reception ordered a very expensive cab which cost over 90 Euro. I guess he figured we dont know any better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: jillian s
Reviews.Content: We read so many bad things about Paris hotels - small rooms, lack of amenities, bad service, etc. so we diligently researched the hotels, but were still apprehensive. The hotel is located in the 6th neighborhood, near plenty of dining, shops, metro stops, and the Montparnasse train station. Pros - we upgraded to a deluxe superior room. Although it was still small by American standards, it was clean and modernly decorated. The bathroom, balcony and closet were a nice surprise and very spacious. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Cons - no alarm or clock in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from Paris metro. Easy to get around the city from this point. Our room was spacious and the staff excellent. Breakfast dining room and food top notch.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice (ignoring a few drawbacks)”
Reviews.Author: Nicktrip
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel has a perfect location between Saint-Germain and Montparnasse, with the metro and train station within 3 min walk. It is nested in a quiet street so its rooms are very quiet despite its almost central location. I had stayed in it, back in 2006, and I can say that there has been a lot of improvement since then. The hotel seems to have been restored, there is air-conditioning (you WILL need it in summer Paris) and the glasses in the (old) windows are now double for better sound and temperature control. The bath is excellent, clean and spacious.The beds are very good as well and provide a perfect sleep. The breakfast is a delight with a rich buffet (almost complete with everything, cold or warm) and excellent service. There are safebox and minibar. But some things of the old past remain: the sheets and towels seem of second quality and the wall-to-wall carpet in our floor corridor (7th) had some big stains on it. The staff also, at first glance, seems unfriendly and unsmiling but prooved very helpful and efficient when needed. The WiFi is free only in the lobby area but not in the rooms. If you prefer wired connection in the room you have to pay an outrageous price of 15 euros per day !!! (come on guys, get serious) Final word: despite a few minor glitches, I would certainly come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, views and great service”
Reviews.Author: danijac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Le Littre last week with a friend in a superior twin room with Eiffel Tower view terrace. I can't speak highly enough of this boutique gem on the southern edge of the 6th. Unlike many European hotels it is certainly deserving of it's 4 star rating. Accommodation was modern, clean and with nice touches such as wine glasses, robes. The bathroom was enormous by Paris standards and our terrace was a perfect place to watch the tower's light show with a wine each night. The breakfast buffet was generous and offered a selection of hot and continental options. Staff were always of great assistance - from booking our day tours and taxis, to ensuring we had a filled ice bucket for a bottle we purchased at the local nicolas. The hotel is located off Rue Rennes, no more than 5 mins walk to Montparnasse station which connects to many of the city's metro lines. Overall a great hotel that I would definitely stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Naomi B
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in my Paris with my mother. I booked this hotel purely off of the strength of the positive reviews and the competitive price and did not know Paris at all well before this weekend. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location: plenty of places nearby for lunch etc and a little further away, one is spoilt for choice with the selection of shops and restaurants in St Germain. At the end of the street there is a Metro station with fantastic links right across the city. The hotel itself was very welcoming and the staff helped make the trip a straightforward and enjoyable one indeed. The breakfast buffet offered a great selection of food from croissants and breads to fresh fruit and cereal. The rooms are ideal: spotlessly clean with a huge bathroom as well as being very peaceful at night. An all-round great experience and I would not hesitiate to come back and recommend to others. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia E
Reviews.Content: The Littre Hotel, is on rue Littre, which is adjacent from rue des Rennes, this street is full with shops, not all fancy as the big malls like Printemps et bon marche (they have all the big and spensive brands) it has a lot of shops, all kind of prices!!! also is just around the corner boulevard saint germain, which has a lot of restaurants and more shop!. he hotel is 1 block from the metro station Montparnass bienvenue, and has across the stress on rue the rennes, 6 lines of buses, so you can choose how to move around in Paris. This Metro can leade you to many correspondances so you can go alms anywhere, if you canÂ´t find your way you can take the "saint Placide" metro which is like 2 blocks up rue des rennes, or the metro "rennes". the bus, takes you to alms everywhere. in the same street there is a fruit shop. around the other corner you can find a market, you have a Tabac across the street, and some restaurants. there is pharmacies near by. the hotel is very up to date on services about paris, so anything you want to do, they will explained the cost, how to get there, or call you a taxi, and make all the arraignments. also a tip: the internet is free on the lobby. over all, the services is good and very organize.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: marbar66
Reviews.Content: Visited Le Littre for 3 nights with a friend & found that every good review for this hotel was true. The staff were a delight, spoke excellent English, & couldn't be more helpful, especially Thomas. The position of the hotel was fabulous - great for walking , eating, shopping & sightseeing with Metro & buses just around the corner from the hotel, which although close to everywhere was so quiet & peaceful at night. The beds also were so supremely comfortable that we didn't want to get up! Our package didn't include the breakfast but just around the corner we found excellent coffee & croissants which were more than adequate & a lot less expensive than the breakfast! One tip for people visiting this hotel for the first time & arriving from Gare du Nord it is a lot easier to walk from St. Placide metro than to find your way out of Monparnasse!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for everything you want to see & do in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: snowshy
Reviews.Content: There were three of us sharing a room (two twin beds + sofa bed) for 5 nights. The room was comfortable and only a little crowded with the sofa bed open.; the air conditioning worked well; the bathroom was huge ( we loved the deep soaker tub) & the closet had just enough room for the clothes of 3 women. We loved that the window's french doors opened for fresh air. Because we were facing a courtyard, there was very little street noise. Every maginable service was nearby. A tiny grocery was 3 doors away where we purchased fruit, bottled water, snacks, wine & beer. There were at least 3 bakeries, a bank & ATM, a post office, local buses, the tourist hop-on hop-off bus, the metro, several bars and restaurants all within 2-3 blocks. We ate at a different restaurant every night. We travelled all over Paris and had no trouble getting back to the hotel in a reasonable time & low cost. Even taxis shared between 3 or more people are very reasonable. Shopping options were too numerous to mention. On our first night , the Solstice Music Festival was on and you could hear the combined voices of singing groups and the sound of strolling musicians well into the night. It was quite magical. The singing ended when rain started to fall in earnest . I imagine that they all just stolled into whatever restaurant they happened to be near and continued...there are certainly dozens of bars & bistros nearby to choose from. The hotel front desk staff were friendly and helpful; most spoke reasonably good English. We received excellent advise about what to see and how best to get there. The hotel provides a helpful events calendar for the week which is produced in several language. Bus/metro tickets were available for purchase at the desk and we were also able to book tours, taxi's and airport transfers. The maids kept everything spotless in the rooms & common areas of hotel. If you want extra towels, glasses etc, it helps to know a little French. When booking the triple room, we were required to purchase a very expensive buffet breakfast option. At first I was a little annoyed but it turned out to be ideal for us. We were out all day site-seeing and really needed a hearty breakfast. Also, two of us are diabetic & having a balanced meal (not too high in refined carbs which seems to be the French norm) is essential. When I looked at the cost of the room (divided by 3) and added the cost of breakfast, I realized that I still paying a very reasonable price for a well located, lovely accommodation in Paris. The breakfast room is on the lower level and serves both hot & cold options. The food choices were basic. eg Eggs, sausage, potatoes, cereal, fruit juice, fruit salad, whole fruit, yogurt, dried fruit & nuts, great local cheeses, sliced meats, baggette, brioche, whole grain bread ( a rarity in Paris), pastries...it really was a more than adequate selection. Plus, we were able to take a piece of fruit or a little sandwich for mid-morning (a diabetic necessity). What I loved was the large individual pots of hot, strong coffee and seperate pots of hot milk (which they would refill). I felt well fed and well-caffeinated to face the day. If you are not a big breakfast eater and have a room that doesn't require you to pay for breakfast, there are numerous bakeries withiin a couple of blocks, a Starbucks, even a McDonalds....so you can definitely eat cheaper at breakfast time. If I go back, I will still choose the hotel's breakfast which it had lots of healthy food options not available at the bakeries.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel central location”
Reviews.Author: gooseeggs Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent customer service all staff extremely helpful rooms to a good standard in good location just a few minutes walk to bus/rail/metro connections lots of cafes, restaurants,creperieres, shops nearby excellent breakfast selection enough to keep you going all day

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but would try another hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: dhjj
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised that they gave us an upgrade to a very large room which even had a walk-in closet. Never having been to Paris, it was what I thought of from the movies with the floor to ceiling doors opening to the veranda overlooking the street and another apt. building. The grade school was down the street so you could see the kids walking to school in the morning and there were several cafe's and a small grocer right next door. I made the mistake of forgetting breakfast was included, and it was a terrific buffet, but caught after a couple of days. The location was good, wi-fi expensive and cumbersome to sign on and the staff was generally very pleasant. Although the room was quite large, the towels were tattered, and the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor. I'm not too fussy, but for what we paid (even with the upgrade) I think they could have gotten some better towels.

Reviews.Title: “Little backstreet hotel lacking some basics but lovely room”
Reviews.Author: LucyInAust
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded and got a huge room with hallway separating the bathroom and the bedroom. It was a beautiful room that looked out onto other interesting apartment buildings in a truly parisian way! The hotel didn't have free wi-fi in rooms which was annoying and I would stay somewhere else next time because of this if they don't change this. It was in an easy location to catch the metro to other areas in Paris, but there was not many places in the immediate vicinity to eat (10 mins walk away there was lots). I wouldn't bother with the breakfast, too many other places better to eat! The staff were polite and helpful. I paid the extra to organise airport transfers through them - which was a bit of a rip off and now I know better I wouldn't do again. As it was on a backstreet I didn't think it was somewhere I would like to return to at night alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Great Location / Staff!”
Reviews.Author: pmarionjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed last June at the HÃ´tel Le LittrÃ© for our honeymoon and loved it so much, we came back this year for our one year anniversary. The hotel is located along the #4 and # 6 Metros with easy access to both (The #6 connects with the RER-A to Disneyland Paris). There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance (fancy, sandwich shops, McDonalds) and a little grocery store on the corner to pick up items. Across the street from the hotel was a mall and a FNAC music store was around the corner. The staff at the hotel was excellent. They went out of their well to help us with everything. The staff spoke both French and English and made things very easy for us upon check-in. We had scheduled a tour also, and the staff even called and verified our reservations for us. The rooms were very nice and well kept. The bathroom was very clean. Each morning, the hotel had a wonderful breakfast in the basement and the staff really took care of us. As soon as we sat down, our cups were filled with coffee! The breakfast had a nice sampling of hot items (eggs, bacon, toast) and cold items (assorted cheese and breads, granola, cereal, fresh fruit). The only downside was that internet access was only free in the lobby. This made it difficult to skype with friends and family, however, the connection was excellent and very easy to access.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service but some issues”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWildMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days in May. The Hotel is in a good location - take advantage of the Metro! The room was spacious. The main issue we had was the bed - it was 2 twins set together so there was a ridge in the middle and lumpy in general. We should have asked about it but never got around to it. Unfortunately, it was remembered after we left/ The bathroom was nice with marble and twin sinks. The shower wasn't fully enclosed (there was a splash guard) so towels had to be left on the floor to soak up the spill-over. The breakfast was large, but didn't vary much day-to-day. The cooked (instant?) eggs needed some help. The staff was very friendly and helpful however. We got some great leads on restaurants from the front desk. They also helped when I lost my credit card and setting up day trips. One of the elevators was broken for the most of the time we were there. Fortunately, we were on a lower floor so we could take the stairs. There is a charge to use the hotel computers for Internet access. This seems a little unusual these days. I'm not sure if they have wireless. There's no fitness center,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie19
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a perfect location. Near Montparnasse metro station and a great selection of restaurants. The staff was welcoming and attentive. We were three in a hotel room and did not feel cramped. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Graduation Present for our Granddaughter!”
Reviews.Author: betsyhamilton
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and found it to be clean, easy to get to and from everything (subway, hop/on/off bus, etc. Lots of cafe's restaurants in this area and known for being the "school" district. Wifi was given out "first come first serve", but we didn't have a problem communicating to home, even SKYPE. The breakfast is nice and healthy options which I greatly appreciated, fruit, yogurt and granola/nuts. The staff was pleasant and offered the info on the area. No designated Les Clefs d'Or here, or Concierge, but they managed to help us along with asking along our way. Would recommend for a nice short stay, and a place where you would not want to be in the hotel all day. Bathroom was good size for the 3 girls....which really helped in our trip being a success. Our travel agent recommended this and we were NOT disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Completely enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Stangdl
Reviews.Content: We were taken care the entire time. Our room was always clean. The superior room was perfect. Shopping was right around the corner. Metros were also just down the block either way. Location was nice. We felt safe most of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erchurch
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Littre was a good choice for us. It is well-located: very near the metro, restaurants and shopping. We found it very easy to get to all the sightseeing spots. The decor was not really outstanding, but definitely not bad. Our room was spacious and though we liked the way the large french door-style windows opened out to an open space, we quickly found that we could hear and see other guests who also had their french doors open. That made it loud at times! The breakfast was excellent and service very good. The front desk was very helpful, though a bit understaffed at times. By Paris standards, it was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “The second time was just as good!”
Reviews.Author: wargoddess
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Hotel Le Littre in late May 2011. This was my second stay at the hotel; I spent a wonderful week there with my mother in May 2010. I have had the experience of returning to a place after a period of time and being disappointed - that was not the case with Hotel Le Littre! Last May my mom and I had a superior room that was very spacious and comfortable - much larger than at similarly priced hotels we had stayed in previously. This time around I opted for a standard room which was smaller, but would be perfectly comfortable for one or two people. Both rooms were immaculately clean. I can't comment on the restaurant because I never used it, but we did go to the bar a couple times for drinks last year and found it to be nice and the bartender to be friendly. The hotel is in a terrific location, close to shopping, cafes, restaurants and multiple Metro stations. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I would happily return to Hotel Le Littre for another stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Dom1874
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hoitel on the first leg of my honeymoon and found it to be wonderful. Its in a great location, very clean, helpful staff anf a very good breakfast. If your staying in Paris, i would recommend trying this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: corgi8888
Reviews.Content: Very good large standard room (112), cleaned daily. Pleasant staff who took the time to arrange a day trip to the Normandy beaches for me. Close to 3 metro lines and the restaurant district just south of Montparnasse metro / train station. A very nice stay, standards just as I recall on my first stay in Aug 2007. Highly recommended and I would be happy to return at some future date. David Seto. Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but..........”
Reviews.Author: twise1
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a fab location to be able to get out and about everywhere. Its surrounded by lots of bars and restaurants so there is no need to starve and the last resort is Macdonalds down the road. The hotel is very nice, clean, has the wow factor when you walk in but the bedrooms are not wow as you would expect in a four star. The beds are comfy but are sheets and blankets, There is very little draw space and the general dÃ©cor although clean and minimal was a bit dull....bathrooms on the other hand are lovely and water pressure perfect, the mini bar costs the earth for diet coke etc so I suggest you buy from local shops. Overall comfortable but tired looking, need a few mirrors on the walls...tv with english subtitles would also be good instead of skynews or cnn! Breakfasts were ok...sometimes the bacon resembled burnt offerings but at least there was choice...it would have been nice to have soya milk, I did ask and was told no so I ended up taking my own milk into breakfast!!! The staff were very friendly and helpful...Jeremy the barman was very pleasant and had excellent customer service skills. Overall a lovely stay and would like to thank everyone involved.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: racsan24
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms. Great breakfast. Freindly staff. Words cannot describe how pleased i am.Stay here, you will love it. Expensive, but when a travel agent puts it in a package deal, you wont notice it.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LondonN19
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the most wonderful 2 days in Paris with our very young children. The Hotel service was impeccable, the welcome we received was outstanding, the room, the best in the hotel with a view to die for, was outstanding, the breakfast, room service, staff (even the transfer taxi drivers) were outstanding. The gifts in the room for the children OUTSTANDING. I felt comfortable, relaxed and will DEFINITELY stay at Hotel Le Littre in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Tour of Paris”
Reviews.Author: mamabee007
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Took my kids to Paris for a quick visit. Stayed at Le Littre and was very pleased. Great room size for all 3 of us. Excellant service. Our room overlooked the courtyard; nothing special, but beyond that we could see parts of the city. Great location, right near the metro, shops and restaurants. The staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially with the kids. Room was cleaned very nicely each day. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Merveilleux!”
Reviews.Author: SailingCindi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here and found the hotel to be just perfect! The concierge/management were attentive to our every need, friendly and welcoming. A lovely breakfast buffet was included and our waiter was so sweet and funny. Our room was small but had everything we needed - it was very pleasantly decorated in white and light green with an antique dresser, desk, loveseat, side tables and lovely botanical prints on the walls along with 2 French windows and a beautiful bathroom. The rooms were spotlessly clean and our bed was firm (the way I like it) and comfortable. The hotel is on a small, quiet street with a Fruitier store a few doors down. We were close to the Metro and a Hop On-Hop Off bus stop. We loved our trip to Paris and we WILL return - and we would definitely stay at Le Littre again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely jewelbox hotel on the left bank.”
Reviews.Author: lella7
Reviews.Content: We stayed there September 2010. The staff was exceedingly helpful and courteous down to the smallest detail. The decor is rich yet inviting. The location is right on the edge of the Montparnasse section of Paris. Very well located near a small super- marche, post office, cafes, even a change bureau on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: njoylyf
Reviews.Content: Lovely European style boutique hotel. We had a king deluxe room, very large with sofa sitting area, nice to come home to after a long day. Very quiet area and little traffic so good sleeping. Walking distance to Metro and convenient for Montparnesse area. Staff very helpful, especially morning maitre' d who added a French flair to our breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: bayres
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, room was spacious and clean. The staff was excellent and helpful. The location was superb! 2 short blocks from the Montparnasse/Bienvenue metro station with connections to all the major tourist sites. Lots of good restaurants within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: flyingscot_9
Reviews.Content: At first glance it is not what you expect from a 4star -down a nondescript side street however ,once you enter you will know you are going to experience a 4star stay The reception area is small but well appointed with beautiful marble floors and the rooms were serviced by 2 elevators Our booking included breakfast and we expected a few pastries/coffee/juice but were pleasantly surprised by a full hot/cold buffet served on freshly laundered linen a nice touch wascoffee served in individual pots with separate jug of hot milk by a very attentive and friendly staff We were lodged on the courtyard side rooms were well laid out,queen size beds flat screen t.v lovely bathroom, modern shower and lots of little goodies (including ear swabs) We enjoyed our stay at le littre and would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price. great!”
Reviews.Author: JillandReece
Reviews.Content: Really friendly family run hotel, room was spacious, clean and tidy, very comfortable double bed with ensuite, fully equipped with mini fridge, safe, LCD TV with some english news channels, ensuite fully equipped with shower over a full size bath, hairdrier and complementary toiletries, buffet breakfast superb, although in a busy part of town no noise from traffic or people whatsoever. Really centrally located hotel which was ideal to spend a short break and to do all the touristy sights. Hotel reception gave us lots of information of things to see and do as well as advise where is good to eat out in the evening etc. Also has a very friendly bar. When we checked out the staff put our luggage in a safe hold. Would defintely recommend and we would defintely go back to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Lchop767
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Paris. We were completely satisfied with our hotel and it's location. The staff were very courteous, friendly and helpful. We had to walk just one block to a main street where there were lots of resturants and the bus stop and metro station. They upgraded our rooms since we were staying for a week. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for first trip in parice”
Reviews.Author: nemogr89
Reviews.Content: hi everyone i came here with my girlfriend a few weeks ago but felt the need to write a review as when ever i visit hotels in the uk i never really write one even if they are good or poor visits.The best part of this hotel is probably the location as it is dead in the centre of paris,very close to tube station (metro) 15 mins in a cab from the eiffel tower,2 minute walk from resteraunts and super markets and great shopping experiences.However!!!!.....for the price you pay for the hotel that seems to be the only thing your paying for. Just a little advise if you visit this hotel make sure you dont touch anything in the mini bar in your room as the staff do not make you aware that its chargable... 5 euros for a redbull....They must be bonkers!.......and a tiny 250ml champaene was like 33 euros....go to a near by store there is one just around the corner..when you first arrive at the hotel they will provide you with a form to fill in....none of it is in english so make sure you ask then what you are signing...i paid for a double bed and i got two single beds pushed together which really cheesed me off..they dont provide a decent amount of shampoo and they dont use conditioner..(for the mrs)......we stayed from a sunday all through to the wednedsday and we saw like maximum of 6 people in that hotel that was not staff...so if you want a peacfull hotel this is a nice place to stay....staff were very friendly and helped alot with directions and spoke good english....depending on what side of the building your on dictates if you have a good view or not....my view was very poor....next timei visit paris i will choose another hotel..no matter where you stay what service or luxury you have in your hotel you are still going to experience over priced items and a huge amount of homeless people asking you for money and atempting to pick pocket...keep your wits about you especially if you are with your loved ones..any one would think you are in the slums of rio!!!!!!.....Just one thing i cant fault with this trip as i mentioned before......BEST LOCATION YOU WILL EVER GET IN PARIS!!!!....cant enthesize it enough...oh and also make sure you bring your own ironing facilities as they clearly dont like ironing clothes.....u have to go to a ironing room in the hotel to iron your clothes....if i was to rate this hotel i would say average...but hope you will have the same jugdement as me or i would feel i was being to picky...Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Lovely cosy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Samstoker
Reviews.Content: Hotel e-mailed me info for train, bus and metro routes to the Hotel prior to visit. Lovely welcome on arrival. Hotel clean, rooms clean and well decorated. Excellent choice of hot and cold breakfast, plenty to fuel up on for the day! Location right by metro station with easy access to many areas, many cafe bars and restaurants all around. Easy walk to St Germain, Lux Gardens and R.Seine. Would recommend Hotel Le Littre for a lovely stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: RuncornKaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and it was beautiful, the staff could not do enough for us. We had our room upgraded and had a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony. Would definately stay here again. Montparnasse is a beautiful area.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: holboomer Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you choose if you want to be a little away from the ' expensive ' bits of Paris. Its very close to Montparnasse Bienvenue with the hotel sign visible from the frtont of the Metro. There are loads of good reasonably priced restuarants nearby. It feels like Paris fro the Parisians. The staff were very helpful, service levels were good and speedy and for a Paris hotel it was very spacious. The occupancy level was low and the public areas seemed thinly populated . As a base for the Left Bank, the Louvre, St Germain, Les Invalides and Musee Rodin it was all not much more than a mile walk and it was an easy no change journey up to Gare du Nord on the Metro

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tabasco74
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this cosy and charming hotel. We thought it was just perfect for a weekend getaway. Perfect location near Montparnasse with lots of shops, restaurants and bars nearby. Rooms are large and clean. We even got a balcony with a view of the Eifell Tower. Perfect! Excellent service by all the staff, and the breakfast service was very nice. I would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travellers looking for a quiet haven in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more...”
Reviews.Author: BhellFibla
Reviews.Content: This is the problem with Paris: you expect too much. This is a hotel that should be charming, because is not a "new" or "trend" hotel. But is just that - old, they should get a remodelation now. Everything is kind of depressing, the carpets, the beds, the windows... even the street that the hotel is sad (and is a kind of "good" location, near the Montparnasse avenue and the Lafayete galerie). The breakfast is horrible, not even the croissant is a safe one. The room is shabby, it is clean, but old - you cannot put this behind. The staff is the best of the hotel: very helpfull, very kind they help us all along our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinaIsrael
Reviews.Content: Our choice of staying at the Le Littre was made as a result of the positive reviews of this site and we were not disappointed. Le Littre hotel is a lovely, elegant and intimate boutique hotel which is well maintained and delightfully decorated in classic French decor. Our standard double room was exceptionally large by Parisian standards and was spotlessly clean. The location of the hotel is unbeatable, in a quite side street of Rue de Rennes, 15-20 min walk down to the banks of the Seine, 3 minutes to the metro stop (Montparnasse Bienvenue) and 1 minute to lot of bus routes just around the corner. The Air-France bus from CDG airport stops at the Montparnasse Gare which is an easy walk to the hotel. The hotel staff without any exception was professional, extremely helpful, friendly and exceptionally personal and attentive, which made our stay very pleasant. The hotel breakfast included a huge selection of cheese, cold meats, pastries, eggs, sausages, fruits and delicious croissants which were perfectly served by an extremely polite, pleasant and professional staff. We absolutely loved our 6 nights stay in the hotel and we will certainly return back .

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Roffee
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel har a perfect location. It's near metro stations and shopping centre, making access to other places quick and easy. Sited at a quiet sidestreet makes the rooms quiet, I experienced absolutely no traffic noise at my stay. However, my room was away from the street, so there _might_ be some noise at other rooms. As a Parisien hotel this is a ok hotel. In my opinion all french hotels can deduct one star from their rating. By "ok hotel" I mean: polite staff, they were most helpful, the room and bathroom was clean and inviting, but still only with basic facilities. There can be better hotels in Paris, but I know for sure there are worse. Next time in Paris I won't go searching for an alternative, but will book this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GuttBouquet
Reviews.Content: We just had a city break in Paris and managed to get a good deal on this hotel. It wasn't cheap, but the room was comfortable if slightly austere. The location is excellent, however, with access to the Montparnasse station probably less than 200 yards away and lovely cafes and restaurants all around. The staff were incredibly helpful and there is a lovely, quiet bar attached to the hotel where you can enjoy a nightcap. The hotel does have (chargeable) secure parking, but really, driving in Paris is the one thing I wouldn't want to repeat! I suppose the one downside was that there are no tea- or coffee-making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: AlisonandMikeSmith
Reviews.Content: We decided on a last minute City Break as a result of our planned holiday to St Lucia being cancelled due to Hurricane Tomas. Our choice of staying at Le Littre was made as a result of being impressed by the hotel web site, and we were not disappointed. The hotel was well maintained and our room was large, with a very comfortable, but firm king size bed with tasteful soft furnishings. The en-suite was clean and functional with plenty of hot water and powerful shower installed above the bath. The downstairs breakfast room was spacious and well set out. The buffet breakfast included juices, fruit, yogarts, cheeses, cold meats, croissants, pastries, toast, eggs and sausages. It was plentiful and staff replenished the dishes as they emptied. Le Littre is situated within a very short walk of the nearest Metro station, with several lines, each taking you directly to the attractions of Paris. However, we walked almost everywhere taking in Paris life as we went. A 15 - 20 minute walk down the Rue de Rennes, and we were on the banks of the Seine. There are numerous bars and restaurants just round the corner from the hotel, where we enjoyed unhurried meals, soaking up Parisien atmosphere. What made the hotel for us, was the staff. Without exception they were professional, friendly and helpful. We were welcomed each time we entered the hotel. If we are in Paris again, the Hotel Le Littre is where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wang75
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I lived in this hotel. The staffs are very nice and always ready to offer helps. Hotel location is nice as well, you may find a lot good restaurant, shops aound and easy to reach the city attractions. Room is cosy and with enough space, I should say it's the biggest room I've ever satyed in Europe. I'll definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnb8
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be avoided. There is no possible way that it is a four star hotel. And no matter how many favorable reviews appear on this site.....all from people with, oddly, only one review in their posting history.....the facts don't change. This hotel is sub-standard in almost every way.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: colliennev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near St Germain and the Luxemburg park which is extremely pleasant to walk in. The hotel staff is very professional and kind. The room was not so big but enough, extremely clean with a large bathroom with a bath and a shower, and bathrobes. The breakfast is excellent with a large buffet with a lot of different food. Unfortunately, it was not possible to get fried eggs with tomatoes and mushrooms. There are no parking spaces in the hotel. However there is a parking close to it (50 meters) but it's an additional cost of 26â‚¬ per day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: MonW56
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is located in an elegant building, on a quiet street, but is only 3 or 4 minutes from the Montparnasse Metro. It doesn't have fancy extras, but those are not things we ever use. WMuch more important to us is a welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff. The rooms delightfully decorated with comfortable beds, and the hotel is spotlessly clean. Le Littre breakfasts are delicious and beautifully served. If we ever return to Paris, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Views across Paris, helpful staff, fabulous breakfast and all reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: PhillipandAlex
Reviews.Content: A small suite on the 8th floor offered a lovely balcony with table & chairs and views across Paris. The rooms were sensibly planned, large bathroom, seperate toilet for instance. Even our teenager liked her own room. Everything you'd expect of a 4 star hotel and helpful staff, fabulous breakfast choices and nothing we could complain about. The streets nearby deserved more exploring but one restaurant close by, Montparnasse 1900, was amazingly Art Nouveau in style and meals came with wine included. We'd go back to Le Littre anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice and quiet, with very helpful staff in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: lynnepenna
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay there, the hotel was comfortable with enough room to move around. There were plenty of places to eat nearby and the Metro station was close enough for us to visit all the places we wanted to see. The map we were given on our arrival was very helpful to find the places of interest in Paris. The staff were all helpful during our stay. We enjoyed breakfast which was included in the price. Would have liked tea making facility in room.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ben-ari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very large suite very nicely furnished . Very clean and very quite. The possibility to make coffe or tea was missing and it required the room service. The breakfast was very good althought some vegetables could make it exellent. The staff was very friendly and very helpful and the service all together was very good. The location is execellent.Some main attractions are in a walking distance.The near main streets are full of different shops,resurants and coffee shops ans so on and it is very pleasant to go out at any time during day and night. A better and faster elevators would improve our impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable and friendly hotel with excellent service in the 6th Arr.”
Reviews.Author: Neil760
Reviews.Content: The staff of this very clean four-star hotel on a small street in the fashionable 6th ARR is friendly and helpful. Relative to other Paris hotels in its category, the rooms are large, quiet and well appointed (safe in the room) and the beds are comfortable. Not expensive given the quality of service and amenities, especially the fabulous buffet breakfast, and the convenient location to several metro stops (St. Placide and Montparnesse).

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve503820
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Littre for our Silver Wedding Anniversary in September, hotel booked through Cresta. The people in reception were very welcoming and helpful, and we were very pleased with our room, it was large, very comfortable, clean and quiet, with a nice bathroom. The hotel is in a good location close to Metro and bus routes, but in a quiet side street. To celebrate our anniversary we went to a restaurant recommended by the Hotel, Le Bel Canto in near L'Hotel de Ville, which was also excellent. Overall we had a memorable stay in Paris, we loved St Germain des Pres, and we were very pleased by the Hotel and by the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “well priced hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsbillfromthenorth
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my 22 year old daughter and we stayed at hotel le litre for 5 nights. The hotel is clean and some rooms seemed recently renovated. There was a large bottle of water and special macaroon cookies waiting for us in our room when we arrived. Although the first room we had had faulty air conditioning, we were quickly moved to another room that was just fine. You'll get bathrobes, slippers, a flat screen tv and good closet space. The front desk staff were somewhat aloof, but who cares when there is all of paris to explore and the hotel is so well situtated. The metro took us everywhere we wanted to go, and there was a metro station right around the corner. The hotel is located in Mont Parnasse which is full of cafes, restaurants, boutiques and even a cinema. There's also a shopping plaza with lafayette galleries that's a 2 minute walk. We always felt comfortable walking around at night because the streets were always alive with people. Make sure you walk around the area because there are 2 street nearby that seem devoted to restaurants that serve crepes. we indulged one evening with dinner and dessert crepes and it was a gastronomical highlight. One tip - if the front desk folks tell you that breakfast is included be careful, especially if you did not book a room and breakfast ahead of time. It's included all right - but you pay extra (a princely sum of 40 euros a day). And if they insist on telling you it is included then make sure to ask if its included in the price you booked at. If not, you do not have to eat there and can go to one of the cafes down the street and eat for much less.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: SwissSushi
Reviews.Content: Mom and I arrived at the hotel from the train station. We were warmly greeted by the staff and given our double room. The room was clean and neat, if a little dated looking. The bathroom was nicely appointed and very clean. We got ourselves settled by hanging a few clothes and putting away shoes in the ample closet and putting our jewelry and other valuables in to the room safe. We went out to explore and found that the hotel is well located with great brasseries, cafes, and bars nearby along with excellent shopping. The Metro station is nearby and the bus stop is too. The staff were very helpful with our questions and requests about currency changing and transportation. The 95 bus, which stops just up the road, takes you DIRECTLY to the Louvre. The trip takes about 10 minutes and costs 1.80 Euros. Anyway, the hotel was quiet. The breakfast we had delivered to our room (included with the COSTCO booked stay) was a good continental style repast. Our ONLY complaints about the room are: the beds are ROCK HARD and wireless internet would be good. Free wireless would be even better, but I understand that free wireless is not the standard pretty much anywhere on the continent. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. If I get back to Paris, I will definitely consider Le Littre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dacul
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel (vacation purchased through Costco). We had a regular room but they upgraded us to a larger room located at 1st floor with view in the interior garden. Staff very courteous, promptly answering all our questions, very large (compared with rooms in other Parisian hotels) and clean room . Towels and bed sheets were changed daily without asking. Breakfast good in our opinion (cereals, milk, coffee, pastries, cheese, ham, salami, omlette, bacon, sausiges, juices, etc.). Location very good, you can either walk to main attractions or use subway (Montparnasse Bienvenue station) or various buses. The hop-on hop-off bus we had tickets for had the station next to the hotel too. Within this area there are many fair priced restautants/pubs where you can eat very well for EUR15-25/person. On Rue de Vaugirard, one block away there is a grocery mini-store very convenient. The only issue we had was in the end we were asked to pay the breakfast for our son (EUR20/day) but this issue I am currently discussing with Costco. However, this price is too large, so if you do not have breakfast included, you may either try to take it over the internet (I saw prices of EUR12 which are closer to reality) or you can take it in any of the sorrounding restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Edward717
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned for a one week stay at the Hotel le Littre in Paris and were pleasantly surprised by the amneties and service offered at the hotel. The hotel is situated in a convenient spot. (Right on the border of the St. Germain and Montparnasse areas. ) Near the Metro and Gare Montparnasse. The staff was always cheerfull and helpful. After a day or two I felt like I was asking a new friend at the front desk for directions or recommendations. Thank you Stephane from the front desk!! The bar was small and quaint. Perfect for a late cocktail. We had a junior suite which was always clean and comfortable. Our only gripe was the construction noise we heard a cple of mornings from the suite above us. Other than that I definitely recommend thsi quaint, quiet gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris. Couldn't fault the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RJF23
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris for my Partner , myself and our two children ( 9 & 12 ). Must say we couldn't of wished for a better Hotel/location. Staff were friendly and helpful. We were very fortunate to of been given an upgrade and this certainly added to the enjoyment but are sure we would of enjoyed the stay in the original room. Breakfast is good, but for the 4 of us would of been 80 Euro's ( not sure if a discount applys to the kids )and given that the children eat little first thing in the morning , the cost would of been high . Breakfast was included in the price , so not a problem, but personaly if we go back and breakfast wasn't included we would eat out in one of the many Cafe's nearby. Overall a very enjoyable stay and enhanced by the Hotel Le Littre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gewitter
Reviews.Content: Good room, good location, good neighborhood, good staff

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Very tense departure”
Reviews.Author: Richarfd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel le Littre from June 30 to July 5. The room was larger than some Paris hotel rooms, but not large by American standards. A good sized bathroom that was up to date was provided. Internet service was free in the lobby only, so several of us hovered over our ipads or laptops in the lobby. The hotel is very quiet, especially for Paris. We ate breakfast in our room, getting coffee in McDonald's and pastries and yogurt in a nearby cafe. The staff was very helpful and nice. My one complaint occurred at the end of our stay. We ordered a car to take us to Gare de Lyon for a train that left at 11:16 a.m. On the advice of the staff, we ordered the car for 10:15 a.m. Without our knowledge, the reservation was changed to 10:30 a.m. and the driver was late, arriving at 10:45. 30 minutes to make our train in Paris traffic was not enough time. We made it only with one minute to spare, and then only by running up stairs with heavy bags (the escalator was broken). I would suggest asking for an earlier pickup time than you need to be sure that your ride gets you to the train on time. Aside from the near heart failure of the departure, we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: tnelias
Reviews.Content: The hotel is worth the value as it is very close to a major metro stop (Montparnasse) and we got breakfast included with the price. We mentioned this was our 10th anniversay trip and they gladly accomodated us in a quiet room with a great view of the Eiffel Tower and a balcony. The staff was friendly and helpful for dinner reservations and all spoke English well. The rooms are clean and acceptable size considering this is Paris. The mattress is very hard but actually we slept quite comfortably. The bathrooms seem newly renovated. They only visited the room for new towels in the morning, and having them come back one more time in the evening would have been a plus as we frequently showered again before dinner given it was so hot. The air conditioning is adequate but fell a little short. It was very hot during our stay and one night the air conditioning seemed to be in slow mode - we had to sleep without the covers and my husband was uncomfortable. There is a limit to how high you can turn it and that was not quite high enough. There is only 1 elevator and it can be very slow at busy times. Plus in the morning the staff is also trying to use it to clean the rooms. Internet was 15 euros/day which is quite steep. There is free wifi in the reception area which everyone seemed to use and worked well. The proximity to the major metro stop is ideal and makes this a place we would stay again, even if this area of town is not our favorite (we like Le Marais the best). Breakfast was good and goes from 7-10:30 am. Recommend getting there before 9:30 am or so or else the food starts to run out and they do not replenish after that. All in all, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel with helpful & friendly staff”
